references.paper_title: Artificial neural networks for solving ordinary and partial differential equations
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of using artificial neural networks to solve differential equations, providing the initial concept and approach that subsequent work has built upon.

references.paper_title: Physics-informed neural networks: A deep learning framework for solving forward and inverse problems involving nonlinear partial differential equations
references.reason: This highly influential work introduced the concept of Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), which has significantly advanced the field and become the basis for much subsequent research.

references.paper_title: Deepxde: A deep learning library for solving differential equations
references.reason: This paper introduced DeepXDE, a widely used and important open-source library that has greatly accelerated the adoption and development of PINNs and related methods.

references.paper_title: Extended physics-informed neural networks (xpinns): A generalized space-time domain decomposition based deep learning framework for nonlinear partial differential equations
references.reason: This paper significantly improved the scalability of PINNs by introducing extended PINNs (XPINNs), addressing the challenge of solving large-scale problems.

references.paper_title: Finite basis physics-informed neural networks (fbpinns): a scalable domain decomposition approach for solving differential equations
references.reason: This work addresses the limitations of PINNs in solving large-scale and multi-scale problems by introducing Finite Basis PINNs (FBPINNs), improving accuracy and computational efficiency.
